reviews.review_text: I was there during happy hour for oysters and it was so good! $2 for regular and $2.75 for premium oysters; with no minimum orders so ordered a few to check out what I prefer then order additional oysters. Happy hour happens everyday so worth checking out if you re in the area. Service was fast and get the bar seats to watch expert oyster shuckers at work.

It was my first time, not only to eat here, but to take my inner artist out to a dinner date. The server was awesome, food was yummy and on time, and I loved that there are so many different kinds of oysters. First time for me to try sablefish and the collars were great!

Came here for happy hour (2-6 pm). Great oysters. Had a blast. Note: only selected oysters are on happy hour price. But its worth trying out others if you are here already visiting. Happy hour oysters are $2 CA, and goes up to $3.50 CA for non-happy hour ones. (Oct 2023 pricing) Recommend Sunny Seeker Oysters

Amazing food at very reasonable prices during happy hour lunch service. Staff were friendly and very attentive. Food came out very quick so kudos to the back of the house for keeping things moving during happy hour! We got lobster rolls, truffle fries, fish tacos, and 2 of each regular oyster and premium oyster. For drinks we ordered their red sangria (rotating basis presumably between red and white wines) and a non-alcoholic local hazy IPA. We arent big drinkers so wont go into detail, nevertheless they were both refreshing and tasty drinks that paired well with our food choices. The lobster roll was great, you can taste the freshness of the lobster meat itself. This was something we did not find in the lobsters weve personally had around Toronto. The dressing and small cuts of veggies did well to complement and complete the lobster roll. Truffle fries were well seasoned, being able to get hints of truffle (presumably from truffle oil) every other bite or so. The aioli paired well with the fries as well. Fish tacos were fresh, the flavor and texture of the coleslaw went well to balance out the grease of a fried fish fillet. I probably could have gone for another order but didnt want to risk a permanent food coma. One set of oysters tasted more of the ocean than the other. Going by what the wait staff pointed out as the regular vs premium, the latter had the more ocean-y briney taste. Not for everyone especially if you arent a fan of seafood, but if you dabble then these are definitely worth a try at a reasonable price. All in all, we were thoroughly impressed with all aspects of our visit. It is on our very short list of places wed definitely revisit on our next stop in Vancouver!

Amazing oysters, and very reasonable happy hour specials. The tuna tartare was delicious as well, and the lobster poutine was good but had very little lobster. Next time I will try the roll. The oyster martini was unfortunately the worst martini experience Ive had and for $18 I was expecting so much more than gin and lemon. Thankfully the waitress kindly took it off of our bill. I will always return for the delicious oysters

This place is in the top 3 of best oysters Ive ever had! And the #1 spot for the best uni (sea urchin) Ive ever eaten. Definitely a 5 star! Lets break down this joint. Great vibin atmosphere. We were seated exactly at our reservation time. Our server was nice, quick, and knowledgeable on the menu. She mentioned the uni was firm and that made me go for it (Ive had some bad experiences with this delicacy). It was delicious. Ordered many different dishes - Sun Seeker, Sweet Select, and Kumamoto oysters were all delicious and fresh. One of them were very meaty. The horseradish is freshly grated. Lobster poutine was packed with lobster but pretty meh overall. Crab cake was a bit dry. 6pc scallop was seared to perfection. The tuna tartare was a bit salty, but still tasted good. The octopus was amazing and tender. And of course as mentioned earlier, the uni was the best and most fresh Ive ever had. The wife says they make an amazing espresso martini. Definitely get a reservation as this spot was packed on a Monday night. They have fresh oysters that you can take home if you like to shuck (who doesnt like to shuck)? When I visit Vancouver again, I will definitely be stopping by.

After checking online for the best seafood we found the reviews of this place good. But when we reached there & had one of the BEST SEAFOOD we will definitely go there again. Service is great Shana was a gem of a person with whom we talked long & her friend guided us through what to choose & have. White wine was great worth every penny. As a tourist we want food which will touch our heart & carry sweet memories back  this was one of it.

Friends and I decided to try out this place before a concert. We were lucky to be there during happy hour because their happy hours are reasonable as they end at 6pm. It was packed! Even though the place was almost full, the service was on point. I appreciated that the staff were available and attentive. And the food?! Absolutely delicious. If you order the lobster poutine, ask if you can have extra lobster for an up charge. Trust me, its totally worth it. Fanny Bay Oyster Bar is DEFINITELY a must-try!

The seafood is incredibly fresh! Highly recommended for seafood enthusiasts. They dont take reservations; its first-come, first-served. Once seated, the owner personally explains the menu and introduces the daily specials. We ordered fresh oysters and premium oysters, as well as the owners recommended daily special - octopus salad for 26 CAD. Additionally, we ordered a tuna tartare. The oysters are exceptionally fresh, with no fishy taste whatsoever. The octopus salad is wonderfully crisp and pairs well with beer. The tuna tartare is a delightful appetizer; the tuna is very fresh, complemented by cucumbers and avocado, providing a refreshing and slightly aromatic flavor. Served with crispy wontons, its both crispy and sweet. In summary, its a fantastic choice for seafood lovers to try

Cheerful staff, vibrant and lively place. Oyster tank right by the unassuming entrance. This place has a very solid happy hour menu (2-6pm I believe). We had fried cod collars and it was deliciously made and a couple dozen oysters (three choices were offered for that days happy hour, one at 1.75, 2 at 2.50 each). If you find yourself in downtown/yaledown Vancouver and craving for some good oyster, this is a spot to visit.

Came here for birthday in the summer. Make sure you have a reservation as this place is busy non-stop. I got the seafood boil and it was everything I could have asked for. My partner and I got a dozen oysters as well and some were as big as her hand. If you re looking for a good sea food place this is it.

I really want to dine in here. I have been craving this restaurant for so long. However, its taking so long to get a table, so me and my partner decided to buy some fresh ones togo. The quality of the oysters is amazing. If you are confident to open the oysters at home, its a good deal to buy and take them home.

Absolutely impeccable service. I was welcomed immediately and straightforward to my seat at the bar. Then came the oyster education. Awesome. I had three minutes until happy hour was up. The server generously said that I shouldn t worry, they would have my order in within the happiest of hours. Delicious, fresh, ocean fragrant oysters! Get the fish tacos. Best anywhere. Be here for happy hour. It s the best in the city. Just make sure you re here before three minutes to six!!! I simply had to order a second round.

This place is fantastic!  Great food, great staff.  Sit at the bar for the best experience.  The bartenders are awesome and artfully craft every drink.  They had a bottle of Lillet on the shelf of the bar, and I wondered what drinks were made with it.  A few minutes later, one of the bartenders presented me with a delicious concoction called a corpse reviver, and it was soo good!   In addition to the great variety of oysters, they also had sablefish collar in the menu, and OMG was it amazing!  We also had the scallops with pork belly which came highly recommended by the staff and didnt disappoint.  Its hard to decide what is best on the menu because everything is!   This was by far my favorite restaurant in Vancouver.

We enjoy this so much that we actually came twice within the 3-day period we were in Vancouver! Such a warm and relaxed place, with great staff and fantastic seafood!  The lobster bisque was outstanding with a generous amount of lobster. The seafood boil was not overly salty and again was wonderfully generous with the best seafood. Just the right amount of kick in the Cajun seasoning so it didnt overpower the seafood. We even got grilled sourdough bread to soak up the sauce because we couldnt let it go down a drain. We demolished the cornbread which was probably the best Ive had because it had additional flavours that gave it more depth and made it less cake-like. If you like pork belly, the scallops and pork belly were a nice modern twist on bacon wrapped scallops and the sauces and vegetables added a refreshing element. Oh and a great assortment of oysters as well! We left stuffed and super happy with our choices!

The food and service were on point. The lobster poutine was fantastic, and the oysters were great. My partner and I went during happy hour, the place was absolutely packed but the service was still impressively quick. Definitely have found a new favourite place for oysters.

This place- 5 stars all around. Amazing food. Period. But even better is the staff. Andrew and Adanary are among the top people Ive ever encountered at a restaurant anywhere on earth. The seafood is fresh, and they literally sell live prawns. Oysters are a must here and happy hour is a steal. Sit at the bar and meet the local crew. Seldom do I find a place where I am greeted and treated as family. Pro tip to the owner- youve hired amazingly.

A hidden gem. Have driven by this location quite often and had no idea what was behind this unassuming exterior. Nice modern interior, excellent friendly staff. We came here for the dine-out experience and had a delicious meal. Each of the appetizer, main, and desert selections was very tasty. The seafood was fresh, the oysters had a nice fresh taste, even the lettuce was fresh and crisp which is more difficult during January. Also a big surprise was the size of each portion. Usually during the dine-out events, the serving portions are more like for a tasting menu. The portions they served were large, probably their normal serving size. So a very good meal at an excellent value.

I couldnt leave Vancouver without trying their oysters. This restaurant had stellar reviews and after trying it, I can see why! Their fanny bay oysters were fresh, meaty and tasty!! Were big fans of East coast oysters but the fanny bay ones changed our minds. We ordered a few oysters as we were there during happy hour and they came within a reasonable amount of time. They also had a special on uni (sea urchin) while we were there so we had to order some - they were delicious. We also ordered their crab cakes and tuna tartare appetizers - so so good. My boyfriend loved the tuna tartare. The place was busy and the service was excellent. If youre looking for some good seafood in downtown Vancouver, I highly recommend you try Fanny Bay!
Pre-concert meal before Ed Sheeran concert at BC Place.  Best oyster bar in DT Vancouver.  Seafood are super fresh.  Special shoutout to Shayna for excellent service

Food is very fresh with awesome presentation and prices very fair. Seafood lovers can t go wrong here. Service was also 5 star. We did have one little miscommunication issue as we put our name on the wait list and told 90 minutes. It only took 25 and we had ordered pasta for a child who was hungry from a restaurant near by. Server said it was okay and brought her a plate and silverware to eat it. Chef came out of the kitchen 10 minutes later and scolded us saying he would let it slide. Uncool since we asked permission ahead of time. Not going to let that guy downgrade the review and sort of like the fact that he only wants his food eaten in the establishment.

Great Seafood and awesome staff. Fresh seafood and variety of flavours on menu. Staff always around to get items, even if they are not your primary server. Food comes out quick. Happy hour until 6 and reservations recommended after 630. Went at 510 and had a short wait to get a table. No reservations during happy hour so if a larger group go near start ot make reservations later. Cajun seafood boil, crab corn bread, raw oyster and uni in pics. Get a side or bread for the crab boil as the broth is excellent and youll not want to waste it. Price is on par with fresh seafood - $69 crab boil, $14 uni, $2 oyster (during happy hour at least), crab corn bread $18, side of bread $4.
Excellent food and service here. The happy hour is really good. We had oysters and fish tacos.
Very popular place, lucky we got in without waiting long. Tasty food. Nice oysters. Good service. Fair prices.

My fiance and I came here to satisfy my Oyster cravings. We came during the Canada Rugby Sevens, so parking was expensive and painful to find. When we came in, we noticed just how busy it was inside, but the seafood decor was a great touch. We were promptly greeted and seated. We were pretty hungry, so we ordered a bunch of stuff: 2 dozen raw oysters (sweet select variety), 5 fish tacos, truffle fries, a lobster roll, caesar salad. We were impressed at how quick and attentive the servers were despite a full house. We sat beside the bar and it was a great show watching them shuck the oysters. All the food we ordered came within 3 minutes which was super impressive. The oysters were so incredibly fresh and the house toppings really complemented the flavors. The fish tacos and lobster roll were so delicious and satisfying too! I kind of wish the lobster roll filling was warm though... Aside from that, we had a fun experience, and all the staff were so friendly and great! We would definitely come back again.

SO good! We did 4 dozen oysters, sampling everything available and all were great. The rose prosecco (not sweet) paired well. We also had the cold octopus dish and it was amazing! Get there when they open at 2p and enjoy a great happy hour.
Fresh seafood and fish. The oysters were fabulous as so was the Sable fish. The place is very popular. I recommend booking to assure a table.

This is my goto Vancouver spot, I m a big fan of geoduck sashimi. This time I brought a visiting group from Halifax and stuffed 7 into a 6 person table. We only had 60 minutes to spare but drinks were on the table quick and food came rapidly as well. Oysters, chowders, mussels & clams and raw large clams were devoured by all, the biggest surprise being the lobster roll which the Easterners gave high marks because it is simple, tasty and the grilled soft bun delicious. Top marks to our server who got everything moving and was there when we needed him.
We arent able to travel out of the lower mainland and have missed going to Fanny Bay on the Island.  We thoroughly enjoyed our visit. Just what the doctor ordered
Had a group family style dinner. No reservation no problem. Incredible food, awesome service, a perfect evening.

Been here a few times now, in my personal opinion, this is still the best (not the cheapest) oysters in town. We ordered all 3 kinds available + a sable fish during this visit, oysters as fresh as it can get, good variety, great sauce. Sable fish was cooked to perfection, buttery as hell while crispy on the outside, served with creamy mushroom and gnocchi, though we enjoyed another place garnish more. Service was quick, friendly and on point. Note: don t put in too big of an order at once for oysters, as you get 1 sauce whether if it s an order of 25 pieces or 6 pieces.

Compared to the prices in Toronto, it s cheaper and of course the oysters are fresher! I recommend their own brands of oysters. You won t get the fishy taste as much as you get when it s shipped over to Toronto and the meat is bigger than a lot of the other oysters from other regions they offer.

Came for happy hour and everything was exceptionally delicious. The staff was so friendly and quick. The oysters were not too briny and very sweet. The tuna tartare was so flavourful and fresh. Great atmosphere and location.

We ordered a Salmon Tartare, dozens of oysters, a lobster Poutine and  2 local beers! The salmon Tartare was  fresh and well seasoned. Oysters doesnt need to be reviewed. The restaurant name title says it all. Lobster Poutine was awesome as well! Little busy in the afternoon happy hour, overall fantastic service from the staffs nevertheless. Food served in 10min! Keep it up team!! Will visit again.

I always make a point to pop by here when I m in Vancouver. I love sitting at the bar and chatting with the shuckers. They have a great happy hour menu and a variety of world class oysters. Everything is grand!

This place is so good I had to go twice during my stay in Vancouver, especially during happy hour. Delicious selection of appetizers and variety of fresh oysters on ice. Also great drinks, will definitely be back.

Great oyster bar in Downtown area. We were here for the happy hours fresh oysters. Turned out all other food from the regular menu were fantastic too. Oysters were fresh but Cherry claims too sweet. (May be not in season yet). The Paella    was loaded with lots of fresh seafood.   Staffs were friendly and knowledgeable. Be prepare to line up during happy hours. No reservations is available.

The Happy Hour is exceptional here! I tried a bunch of stuff from their menu (oysters, sablefish collars, croquettes, lobster roll, mussels and clams, and the fish tacos). Overall most things were very good and everything tastes super fresh. I would say the stand outs were the premium oysters (the day I went it was I believe Sandunes PEI), fish tacos and the mussels & clams. I thought the lobster roll was a bit light on the lobster and the collars needed a bit more sauce, but overall everything is very high quality The staff is also extremely nice, and the interior is very cool. This spot definitely gives you a taste of the PNW, and has many things to try. It is fun to go with friends and get a few things to share. I didn t try any of their entrees from their non-happy hour menu, but they sounded good too.

Had a wonderful dining experience. We had oysters, paella, lobster mac, clam chowder, fish tacos and apple tartin.  Everything was very good especially the lobster mac and paella. I am usually not a fan of apple tartin but this one is so good.

One of the best places in Vancouver for happy hour oysters: $2 for regular and $2.75 for premium. My favorite ones are always fresh oyster and truffle fries. Other dishes in the regular price menu comes with small portion and quite pricy. Restaurant is always busy during happy hour even on weekdays, but waitlist moves pretty fast since there is a time limit for each table.
Freaking love this place! My boyfriend and I love this place for happy hour oysters!
If you like oysters- this is the place for you. We found this place by chance, and are so glad we stopped by. It was a great experience with even better food.
We got the chowder,  sea-cuterie  board and a dozen oysters and we were not disappointed. Service was friendly and attentive and the food was delicious!

This place is the best oyster bar we have ever been to! The oysters were fresh, the service was very fast, and all other food was outstanding too. The bathrooms were clean, single-occupancy, which was nice too. We went to this place twice, and we loved it both times! Highly recommend.

We walked from our hotel to this place (20 min walk + 20 min wait time) and arrived calorie-deprived. Ordered lonetree apple cider + clam chowder + lobster roll + lobster poutine + two dozens of Fanny Bay oysters for two people (what can I say, it s a lot of food but YOLO). My god, the quality of the food this place serves is so good that it should be illegal. The service is also superb. As a reciprocative man I left a generous amount of tip. Highly recommend this place.

Loved this oyster bar in Vancouver. Arrived in the early part of happy hour (4-6pm) and got a table but noted queues on our way out.  Oysters reasonably priced and super fresh - recommended. Also had the truffle fries - pretty good. Tried the tuna tartare - not bad but not wow. They had a lovely white peach sangria when we visited which is perfect in summer.
The food was was really good but, didn t blow our minds. The lobster bisque was not hot. The oysters were great, love the vibe. Excellent service!

Happy hour $2/oyster is amazing. Vibe was great. Got there at 4:15 pm on a Wednesday and already quite busy. By 5 pm there was a line waiting. They have a 1h45m seating time. Wonderful air conditioned interior

Recommend! I can tell the taste difference among three kinds of oysters. I liked a black squid ink pasta with scallops and shrimps. I also like the copy at their back of T-shirts said  Tide to Table !

The bartender was so friendly. We talked about Fanny Bay Oyster history and he was very easy to talk to. What a great atmosphere! Tip: Get here early if you want in on the Happy Hour Specials or prepare to wait. (The wait is worth it if you do.....)

This is a great place to enjoy some high quality seafood! We ordered the paella for 2, the grilled oysters, some raw oysters, and the fish tacos. The paella was visually striking with all its colours, and had tons of seafood! In terms of taste, I thought it was good, but became a bit greasy/heavy towards the end. The portion size was great too, we got a paella for 2 and split it between 3 people, and it was more than enough (although we each ordered some oysters as well). I really liked the grilled oysters as well, but my favourite part of the meal has to be the fish tacos. The fish was perfectly fried, and paired perfectly with the pickled onion and the mango aioli. These were by far the most delicious tacos Ive ever eaten, and I would come back just for them. Overall I thought the service was professional and the dining environment was nice as well. I thought the prices were reasonable for the quality of food, but I would probably consider this a 3 dollar sign restaurant, especially if you plan on ordering any oysters.

We visited on a Wednesday afternoon for a late lunch. We had a selection of oysters including the oyster shot with uni - so delicious!! All of the oysters were flavourful and the accompaniments were great. We also had the octopus with chickpeas which was very flavourful and not tough. Service was fantastic! Very informative and helpful!! Can t wait to visit again.

Fanny Bay never seems to disappoint! They have a fantastic happy hour menu along with some amazing dinner options. Happy hour oysters are $1.75 or $2.50 (premium). Unfortunately they dont take reservations for happy hour so come early! If theres a wait, they will take down your name/number and text you when your table is ready.

This place was fantastic. We had to wait about 30 minutes to get a table, but that was not a problem (as wed never get another chance being from California), and it was well worth it. Once seated, we ordered our variety of oysters, lobster rolls, and drinks. The service, the food, the drinks.... yes, yes, yes. Wish we were closer to this place to be able to frequent it more often. Loved it all. If you love and appreciate oysters, this place is a must. Get in line; that will be the last thing that youll remember when walking out completely happy and satisfied.
Amazing oysters! Super fresh and juicy, probably the best I ve had in Vancouver. The staff were friendly and gave good recommendations on food and drinks, definitely would come again.

As a Chef, I must say this is the best place for oysters and seafood in Vancouver, no comparison. Best Happy Hour in Vancouver Freshest Oysters from their own company Amazing staff and fun atmosphere There is a reason everyone suggests this place

My first time here tonight and I must say awesome oysters pkace, even better than Rodney s actually. Service was great and the guy - Andrew at the bar shucking all the oysters were such a pro. Andrew was awesome with his service, friendliness and we also had great conversations! Will be back for happy hour some time!
Special thanks to Hanna and Andrew for the excellent service. PLUS all the staff are very helpful and professional ! We enjoyed very much !

Service was slightly lacking but the food made up for it! Visited as part of an epic holiday celebration with my friend! Had the lobster, ciopinni, Cesar salad, one of each type of oyster, geoduck and uni sashimi, as well as the seared scallops and pork belly ! Lobster was doused in buttery garlicky decadence    ciopinni had tons of seafood and wonderful grilled sourdough      geoduck and uni sashimi were transcendent (first time I ve ever seen sashimi sharing the same menu as Pacific Northwest dishes   Salad has a great anchovy flavour in the dressing   oysters tasted briny and very fresh    seared scallops and pork belly were a little on the sweet side but paired well with the bitter radicchio and roasted cauliflower Looking forward to including this restaurant as part of my yearly epic seafood dinner celebration with my friend!
Oysters are delicious. Service is really good. Truffle fries are lack of truffe flavour tho.....

Great service, fresh seafood. We enjoyed their happy hour (1.75 per shuck for featured) fresh oysters, paella, steamed mussels&clam. I couldnt drink that day, so I must come back to enjoy the oysters with some sparkling rose. Bar seats werent bad!

My family ate here on 28 May. Service was first class. Food was wonderfully good. Tall tables and chairs. My wife and I were not young. So we had a bit of difficulty getting up and down the bar height chairs. But it was ok. A great experience. Ambience was nice but affected by a customer on another table who kept coughing throughout his stay. Hope he recovered well.
Recommended by a friend who is a regular. All the dishes were superb. Couldn t stop slurping on the oysters. The fish taco and the chowder were delish. All the staff were friendly and responsive.

Great service and really good oysters! Came with a friend who comes here often and can say hands down the best most freshest oysters I ve ever had.  Must try is the oyster shooter with the gold flake. Very good. Aside from that their regular menu/cooked food was very good as well.

Happily ran into this place and got in at the beginning of happy hour 3pm-6pm (if you do try to go, try to get here before 3 as a line starts to form). Although we tried the oysters which were good, we had never had them before and discovered we aren t oyster fans lol! After that we ordered the fish tacos, muscles and clams and the pork belly with scallops   so good highly recommend you try any of those dishes and pair it with a white wine
Happy hours from 2 to 6pm. Good variety of items to eat and drink, fair price. Oysters are fresh and delicious. We had good service.
Amazing oyster shop. I come here often :)

It is rare that my family 100% agreed this restaurant worth out 5 stars vote! Warn & friendly service makes east coast folks like us feel right at home. We arrived in time for happy hours.. Boss Gibson, Olympia & Kusshi are on special, while all of them are fresh, Kusshi was really the one that shines, with delicates & clean flavour.. we had to order a second round. Kids enjoy great fish & chips as well as a fresh Geoduck, Prawn & Octopus pokebowl.. I also had an amazing crab cake to round out the night. Great to be in Vancouver

We were a group of 5 and it was our first visit. Everyone enjoyed their meals very much. Mussels were amazing. Oysters in the half shell were delicious. Scallops & Pork Belly was perfect. Side of potatoes with roe on top was very tasty. And you must get the bread. Service was great, very attentive.

Started lining up at 2:50 in time for the 3pm happy hour and there was quite a long line after us. The servers were very friendly and food came fairly quickly. The sablefish collars was my absolute favourite. The paella wasnt as good as the reviews made it out to be sadly but still good. Overall definitely would come back again and Im not normally a huge seafood lover!

This is a great place for happy hour, which is currently from 12pm-6pm I believe!!! They have $1.5 oysters, which is definitely worth it not to mention a good variety of items to choose for. In terms of value and quality, this is one of my favourite happy hour joints! This is worth the drive for all your seafood lovers, looking for a good deal! I d say must haves are oysters, sablefish kama, parm fries and fish tacos. Only thing I didn t like were the cocktail prawns... to small and wasn t as fresh as I d like them to be.

Really had a great happy hour meal. Got there for 3pm and there was plenty of space but still pretty busy for a 3pm restaurant. The Fanny bay oysters were beautifully served and I would recommend having it with the lemon, tabasco and migonette together. The tuna tartar was absolutely amazing, the tuna, cucumber and avocado work so well together and are perfectly serve on the crisp.
Good variety of oysters. Their truffle fries are supreme, even their steak is done properly. Clam chowder was thick and creamy with chunky ingredients every spoonful. Will be back for more!

Really nice bar, close to our hotel and the Whitecap stadium. Past by on numerous walks, had to give it a try. Food was outstanding, cocktails were spot on. It you dont eat raw oysters, why would go (idiots at the table next to us!). We did a plate of oysters and the Sablefish Collars. These deserve a Michelin rating.
Quick service with amazing foods and pricing during happy hour. The lobster roll was fresh and delicious. The oysters were delicious
The best seafood platter Ive ever eaten in quite sometime. The food, service and atmosphere were terrific!!!

My mom and I never eat seafood but we ended up ordering 2 dozen oysters and the fried chili oysters twice and the brussle sprouts   she absolutely loved it and said we wanted to come back here tomorrow. This place has the best staff and a really cool marble tabletop by the shucking bar where my mom entertained herself the whole time. Everything was so fresh and tasty. I m sure everyone would have a good time here! I think my mom has now been converted into a seafood fan

Awesome oysters and great, friendly service! Nice hangout place with good food and drinks! Good happy hour! Theyre specialty Oyster is the best that we tried! Also, our server Alexa was awesome! I was a newbie at oysters and she helped explain everything and made the experience so much better! The bartender guy was so sweet as well! We ordered the crab legs and those were to die for!

My second time trying oysters, not a bad experience but still not used to the texture yet. But they were fresh, I like them better with the limon juice and horseradish. The clam chowder was good but not the best Ive tasted. The surf & turf were my favourite and can be shared. Service was good. We will definitely fine here again.
I had a blessed enjoying the seasonal prawn, raw oysters, clam and mussels. Highly recommend this place.

Fantastic seafood. Lots of Oysters to choose from. Very fresh. Super friendly wait staff. Every entree was very well done. The mussels and fish were very fresh and flavourful. Not rubbery at all. The prices were fair for the quality of food being offered. Well worth the price.
Great place with the freshest seafood and focused on oysters. The service was outstanding.

Excellent. I highly recommend. Crab cake excellent. Grilled oysters were wicked good, so good I ordered a second round of them. Fanny Bay raw oysters were good. Brussel sprouts were very good. Beer/wine excellent. Services was friendly/quick/excellent. Reserved a table on  open table  and we were seated right away when we arrived.
Every time I come here the food never disappoints. The mussels are so big and so fresh, oysters are amazing, and best of all the staff are so friendly. A must come to place if your in Vancouver.

I love coming here for happy hour. The fish tacos are delicious and they have a good selection of oysters and happy hour oysters do not disappoint. The service here is wonderful as staff let keep you updated with a last call during happy hour. They made a mistake with my oyster order but just ended up not charging me for the extras I didnt order. I come here every time I visit Vancouver!

It s a nice restaurant, since it s in the city you need to pay for street parking. We went specifically for the happy hour oysters. We recommend just getting the regular oysters and not the premium because they weren t that sweet. Also got the lobster roll which was good but I thought I was getting 2 buns but instead got 2 half buns. The service was so fast we were only there for 30 minutes since seating to paying! Parking: There s only metered street parking.

Came for a friends birthday dinner. Service was AMAZING. Hands down never experienced better service anywhere in Vancouver. The food was great. Its so insane that this place didnt get an actual michlin star. Those guys are dropping the ball. To those who might be scared to get raw oysters-- Im someone extremely sensitive to any contamination to the extent that the same oysters that gives my friends mild stomach discomfort would land me a fever for a week. I ate 1.5 dozen here and absolutely nothing happened. Can vouch with 300% confidence   I hope to be back soon!

It is located near bc place. People who want to try different kind of oysters or shells I highly recommend this place. They serve not only oysters but also crabs, lobsters and pasta. However, from 5:00 p.m the restaurant can be easily full of people so visitors would better to book before they visit. People who want to save money, better to visit in HAPPY HOUR time.
Friendly upscale seafood, bar/restaurant with lots of variety. Good for a date night or special occasion. The food was above average, and so was the service and atmosphere.

Fantastic value! Went at happy hour and devoured the fresh oysters, and the fried oysters were amazing! The clams were so flavourful, hubby drank up the whole bowl of sauce lol! Service was incredible too, great experience and will be back for more!
Oh yay! Everything was sooooo fresh and delicious. Great cocktails and excellent service

This restaurant is not too far from JW Marriot Hotel, where we have stayed a  few days in Vancouver. This is not a big restaurant, so we have made an advance booking. When we arrived, many people were waiting to be seated. We ordered one dozen oysters with 3 different sizes and tastes, and then followed with another dozen. We also ordered other seafood dishes and wines. Oysters were reasonably priced with $3.50 each and extremely fresh. All the dishes were very delicious. The restaurant was fully packed with customers and gave an exciting atmosphere.

Great oyster bar with a lot of happy hour specials. Make sure you check the time because the value is pretty decent. It s not a super high-end place but more of a casual drinking/oyster bar. There was a small shop inside where you can buy some of the products and cans or also in the freezer.

Yum! Was my first time here for happy hour and was pleasantly surprised. Got here around 2:40 and got a spot for 4. Ordered a round of drinks (I got the spicy Paloma, it had a delicious salt rim) and ordered our happy hour noms! The sun seeker oysters were super fresh and delicious with hot sauce. The tuna tartare was beautifully presented with 8 chips. We enjoyed the mixed mussels and clams in white wine broth. The bread was a little hard to cut and break up though  still delicious since we wanted to soak up the sauce. The brussel sprouts were perfectly seasoned, and the truffle fries were great as well. Will definitely go again!

We had a fabulous experience here. Everything is fresh, tasty and seasonal. We arrived around 7pm on a Sunday and it wasnt too busy and service was attentive. An hour later every table was filled. Book a reservation to avoid disappointment. Worth a visit.

You wont find better oysters anywhere else in Vancouver unless you are farming them yourself. Our oysters were expertly shucked by Hana and they came with all the proper accoutrements. We also had a smoked salmon carapaccio with pickled kelp that I still dream of to this day.

Happy Hour Oysters were $1.75, service was great, had to wait for 45 mins, but the host was really nice. Loves their Truffled fries, you can add this on to the Clams and Mussels. Would def go back again.

Always a good time. Love coming here for oysters of course. Seems like all employees are friendly. It is busy and loud all the time but I think it adds to the atmosphere. Lobster rolls were good too :))

Came here for happy hour. Easy to make a reservation! They have many different kinds of oysters but only one is available for the happy hour special. Still delicious nonetheless. Oyster shooters were delicious as well. Service was great and accommodating.

Absolutely loved this place. As soon as we walked in Saturday morning we were greeted by an easy going young guy that had the right combination of service and entertainment, with a laid back casualness that you never get in Toronto; it was refreshing. His oyster recommendations were as spot-on as the food. I was reluctant to try oysters again at first because I got food poisoning last time I had them in Toronto. Im happy I tried them here because I was absolutely blown away. The scallops were beyond incredible, as were the home cut fries and the oyster po boy sandwich-best po boy Ive had yet! I will definitely be coming back here every time I am in Vancouver.
